result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin L. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim.

 IF AGENT IMPOSES:
  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
Cases called.  14CM500, 14CM607, 15CM88 and 14TR5006. Defendant Marvin L. Peterson in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties file stipulation and recommendation.  Charge amended in 14TR5006 to reckless driving.   Court Reviews PQWOR.  Review of charges/penalties.  DE pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2 on 15CM88.  Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of both counts.  DE pleads guilty to 14TR5006, amended charge of reckless driving.  Case 14CM500 is dismissed, 14CM607 is DRI.  Atty. Barrington is heard on recommendation, Court approves amendment of charge to reckless driving.  Atty. Guza is heard, requests return of property siezed, Atty. Barrington does not object to return after appeal time has lapsed - Court orders.  Mr. Peterson is heard.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

14TR5006:
$200 fine plus costs = $389.50

15CM88 Counts 1 and 2:
Sentence withheld,
Probation for 12 months with conditions:
Court costs,
no violent abusive contact with anyone,
AODA assessment and follow thru,
Absolute sobriety, (If imposed by agent)
No premises of bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents, (if agent imposes)
not operate MV without valid DL,
No contact or communication with victim.

Forfeiture to be paid out of bond money.
$50 per month on remaining amount.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

9:39 - 14CM607 & 15CM88 - Defendant, Marvin L. Peterson in court, Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Defendant says has counsel but couldn't be here today. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Return date scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
